instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
threads.message: hi.i have here <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> just stop working. i have green light on charger but not powering up.  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.286v. dont know how to fix it. i replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> but still nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
threads.message: You need to be looking at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on this one first; forget <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> especially, since you're not in s0 yet. Look at all s5 rails. Did the board have liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
threads.message: board with no liquid damaged just stop working,   <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.63v        <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>- 3.46v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
threads.message: I have exactly the same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no powering up but green light on charger
threads.message: Check all rails for shorts. Check PPVRTC, check for power pulsing on 5V rail
